availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John P. Grinstead (Metcalfe County, KY, soldier)

body.p:
Metcalfe County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Phillip W Grinstead and
Angelina Grinstead. Resident of Barren County in 1850. Resident of Metcalfe County in 1860. Served in 9th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant, second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain from November 25, 1861 to December 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, Division 2, p. 444A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Metcalfe County, p. 398.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 796, 800.
Kansas Grand Army of the Republic Post Reports, 1880-1943, Topeka, Kansas: Kansas Historical Society, Post 57, Wellington, Sumner County, 1891, p. 78 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "John P. Grinstead (1846-1915)," Memorial #26656943, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/26656943 (accessed March 4, 2020).
